1222510537
Problem: blast
Summary: Tile Blaster
Weight: 500
Time limit: 0.5 second(s)
Memory limit: 32 MB
Test cases: 20
Description:

In a game of Block Blast you have to finish all the tiles on the board. The tiles are of different types. When you click on any tile and if it is a part of a block of 3 or more tiles of same type which are orthogonally contiguous, the entire block disappears and the tiles above it fall down to take their places. You continue this process to blast away all the tiles on the board. Obviously you need a strategy to solve the board. Presently we will solve a simpler sub problem. At any given instance of the board, how many of the tiles when clicked on, will reduce the number of tiles on the board. The tiles are numbered 1 to 9. Tiles with same number are tiles of same type.

Note: Do not bother about the falling of tiles.

Formatting/Constraints:
  • Input:
    1. Line 1: m n (the size of the board: m rows x n columns)
    2. Line 2..m+1: String representing the ith row.
    3. 1 <= m, n <= 50
  • Output:
    1. Line 1: The number of tiles that match the required criteria.
Examples:
  1. Input: 
    4 5
11223
12234
13333
31224
    Output: 
    13
    Analysis:
    Nothing in the last row can be clicked on. Also the last tile (3) in the 0th row, and the last tile (4) in the 1st row can't be clicked on either. That leaves 20-7=13 tiles.
  2. Input: 
    4 10
1122334455
2233445511
3344551122
4455112233
    Output: 
    0
    Analysis:
    There are no othogonally contiguous groups of three tiles or more here.
  3. Input: 
    10 10
3123133322
2133232111
1313322112
3333222311
1213231312
1312321312
1311111331
1113311321
2332233212
3221123123
    Output: 
    57
    Analysis:
    A bigger board.
